page.title: 17EDUCATION IN UFFCULME
page.content: There are two schools in this area, both in Uffculme. The Primary School (age 5-11 yrs.)has six classes and about 160 children. It is expanding at present due to increased house- building in the area. Children come mainly from the Village, Ashill and surrounding farms and Hamlets. The P.T.F.A. have just completed a new pemanent swimming pool here which will be an asset for the whole local community. The Comprehensive School (age 11-16 yrs.) has about 700 pupils and this too is expanding. This draws pupils from the whole of the upper Culm Valley and many also come from other areas. Both schools play a full part in local village life and much use is made of the premises of these two establishments by other village organisations.
